review_title: Mandated double shifts at minimum wage
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Lake Placid, NY
pros: One extremely helpful/caring nurse/instructor (now retired I believe) but others are just too overworked to care. The patients are the best positive. The highlight was having a non-mobile, non-communicative patient smile/laugh with her eyes when I was telling her about my childhood and when I took her hand, she squeezed it.
cons: 3 mandated double shifts/week... so you are working 8 shifts/week. Most of my patients were non-mobile/bedridden and many were also non-communicative, except for the eyes. Instead of having a normal 7-8 patients I had 14-17 on my own on day shift as a CNA with no support.

review_title: Great Community but very remote location
pros: There is a nice small town feel and large sense of community. I have encountered nothing but friendliness among the town's people. People in the community tend to help each other more and will go out of there way for each other - even strangers. Everyone smiles and says hello.
cons: Since this is such a remote location, employees tend to be overworked and expected to do the job of multiple people. No room for time off since there's nobody to cover shifts.

review_title: Overall not a bad place to work in Saranac Lake.
pros: Decent salary for the area, co-workers are easy to get along with, not to much stress on a daily basis.
cons: Not a lot of opportunity for advancement, largest employer in the area so there is no competition unless you want to relocate.

job_title: Patient Access in Saranac Lake, NY
pros: Management did the best they could regardless of the constant lay offs. Multiple departments closed and they would try to reassign staff instead of losing them.
cons: Layoffs made it difficult to gauge where you were headed. Your manager would ask you to "cover" another department and you'd end up staying there with out training for several months, unsure of who you reported to.

job_title: Clinical Systems Analyst in Saranac Lake, NY
pros: Everyone cares about doing things right by the patient. Excellent new CEO and a good group in middle management. The work/life balance is amazing.
cons: Communication can sometimes be a problem, but that happens everywhere. Sometimes low performing employees are given too many opportunities. Not a lot of room for professional growth due to hospital size.

review_title: Revolving door ... don't even star at the AMC-Uihlein long-term care facility in Lake Placidt!!!
pros: The patients can be great but I worked in the ward where they couldn't move or talk on their own much.
cons: Everything.  The pay sucks.  They mandate you to work 3 double shifts per week... that means 8 shifts!!!  I would work 7am to 11pm three days a week and then the normal 7-3 on the other two days.  I would get home at 11:30pm and have to leave again at 6:30am...

pros: Did not cut any of our positions or time during Covid
